publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-972# Des McNulty: Millennium Development Goals-That the Parliament notes the 10th anniversary of the genocide in Rwanda and continuing poverty in sub-Saharan Africa; recognises the extreme urgency of international efforts in making progress towards achieving the eight millennium development goals by 2015 including the eradication of extreme poverty and hunger, achievement of universal primary education, promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of women, reduction of child mortality, improvement of maternal health, combating HIV/AIDS, malaria and other diseases, ensuring environmental sustainability and developing a global partnership for development; further recognises the role that churches and other civic society organisations in Scotland have played in reminding us of our responsibilities to people in the poorest countries, and looks forward to a timetable being set by Her Majesty's Government for meeting its commitment to increase the UK aid budget to 0.7% of gross national product.
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Eleanor Scott*, Michael McMahon*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Nora Radcliffe*, Maureen Macmillan*, Jackie Baillie*, Sarah Boyack*, Mike Pringle*, Nicola Sturgeon*

S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Margaret Jamieson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Michael Matheson*, Murray Tosh*, Chris Ballance*, Robin Harper*, Patrick Harvie*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Susan Deacon*, Bill Butler*, Marlyn Glen*, Mark Ballard*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Cathie Craigie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Mr Keith Raffan*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Helen Eadie*, Stewart Stevenson*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Watson*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Shiona Baird*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Pauline McNeill*, Dr Jean Turner*, Scott Barrie*, Trish Godman*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Karen Gillon*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Cathy Peattie*

S2M-972# Des McNulty: Millennium Development Goals-That the Parliament notes the 10th anniversary of the genocide in Rwanda and continuing poverty in sub-Saharan Africa; recognises the extreme urgency of international efforts in making progress towards achieving the eight millennium development goals by 2015 including the eradication of extreme poverty and hunger, achievement of universal primary education, promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of women, reduction of child mortality, improvement of maternal health, combating HIV/AIDS, malaria and other diseases, ensuring environmental sustainability and developing a global partnership for development; further recognises the role that churches and other civic society organisations in Scotland have played in reminding us of our responsibilities to people in the poorest countries, and looks forward to a timetable being set by Her Majesty's Government for meeting its commitment to increase the UK aid budget to 0.7% of gross national product. Supported by: Eleanor Scott, Michael McMahon, Nora Radcliffe, Maureen Macmillan, Jackie Baillie, Sarah Boyack, Mike Pringle, Nicola Sturgeon, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray, Michael Matheson, Murray Tosh, Chris Ballance, Robin Harper, Patrick Harvie, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Susan Deacon, Bill Butler, Marlyn Glen, Mark Ballard, Ms Wendy Alexander, Cathie Craigie, Roseanna Cunningham, Marilyn Livingstone, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Helen Eadie, Stewart Stevenson, Elaine Smith, Mike Watson, Donald Gorrie, Shiona Baird, Pauline McNeill, Dr Jean Turner, Scott Barrie, Trish Godman, Ms Sandra White, Karen Gillon, Cathy Peattie, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-972# Millennium Development Goals (lodged on 27 February 2004) Dennis Canavan*
